desc.text: Ver 7.3.1: 30-04-2025: SB-10407: S2.2.b,4.3.1.a & 4.3.2.b mandatory fields adjust. Ver 7.3.1: 09-04-2025: SB-10371: S4.3.1.a - mandatory fields adjust. Ver 7.3.1: 03-04-2025: SB-10371: Check XML-XSD Ver 7.3.1: 02-04-2025: SB-10332: Final Ver 7.3.1: 19-03-2025: SB-10332: Correction of bugs of MEDTECH Ver 7.3.1: 13-03-2025: SB-10332 feedback Medtech Ver 7.3.1: 22-01-2025 SB-10225 Feedback MEDTECH : Change attribute for the key "massKG" & "heightCM" to "xsd:integer" for all XSD files Ver 7.3.1: 17-01-2025 SB-10225 Feedback MEDTECH : Resolving issue on signature + section 1.3.1.f unselect radio button + section 4.2.d field mandatory correction Ver 7.3.1: 20 Nov 24 Add default value to sCreateTimeStamp and sFormLanguage Ver 7.3.1: Full restore completed Ver 7.3.1: Red border issue on section 2.3.p Ver 7.3.1: Update the out.xsl for manufacturer issue Ver 7.3.1: Updated the code copy/paste section 2.3.p Ver 7.3.1: Restoring codes due to crash of application (SB-9903) Ver 7.3.1: 01-03-2024 - SB-9481 Fix max length to 4000 Characters Ver 7.3.1: Add some fields, labels and business rules (SB-9263) Ver 7.3.0: add drop-down list, change title (SB-7677)

damage; disability or permanent damage; congenital anomaly/Birth defects; indirect harm; no serious outcome)

value.text: (will be auto populated from previous selections)
IMDRF adverse event reporting terms and codes
IMDRF=International Medical Device Regulators Forum. Coding with IMDRF terms is a mandatory requirement.
Submission of this report does not represent a conclusion by the manufacturer and / or authorised
representative or the national competent authority that the content of this report is complete or
accurate, that the medical device(s) listed failed in any manner and/or that the medical device(s)
caused or contributed to the alleged death or deterioration in the state of the health of any person.
I affirm that the information given above is correct to the best of my knowledge.

body.p: UDI device
identifier
UDI production
identifier

value.text: Page 05 - Section 2.6 a - Relevant accessories used with the device being reported on
Page 05 - Section 2.6 b - Relevant associated devices used with the device being reported on

body.p: 3.1 a -Provide a comprehensive description of the incident
3.2 f -Remedial actions taken by healthcare facility, patient or user subsequent to the incident
3.3 a -If you think the incident is unique and a suitable IMDRF term is missing, briefly explain
3.2 a - If you think the incident is unique and a suitable IMDRF term is missing, briefly explain
3.3 e -List any of the patient's prior health condition or medication that may be relevant to this incident
4.1 a -For initial and follow-up reports: preliminary results and conclusions of manufacturers investigation
4.1 b -Initial actions (corrective and/or preventive) implemented by the manufacturer
4.1 c -What further investigations do you intend in view of reaching final conclusions?
4.2 a -Description of the manufacturers evaluation concerning possible root causes/causative factors and conclusion
4.2 b -Fill out rationale for why this is considered not reportable
4.2 d -Rationale for no review
4.2 d -Results of the assessment:

value.text: Page 09 - Section 4.2.e - If exceptionally no relevant IMDRF code is available or specific enough, then provide additional information below
Page 09 - Section 4.2.f - If exceptionally no relevant IMDRF code is available or specific enough, then provide additional information below

body.p: 4.2 g -Description of remedial action/corrective action/preventive action/field safety corrective action (FSCA)

value.text: Page 09 - Section 4.2.g - Description of remedial action/corrective action/preventive action/field safety corrective action (FSCA)
Page 09 - Section 4.2.i - Final comments from the manufacturer on cause investigation and conclusion
Page 10 - Section 4.3.1.a - Other selected: enter description of what similar (serious) incidents are based on and the rationale why the above IMDRF codes were not used
Page 10 - Section 4.3.2.a - Other selected: enter description of what similar (serious) incidents are based on and the rationale why the above codes were not used

rdf:Alt.rdf:li: Ver 7.3.1: 30-04-2025: SB-10407: S2.2.b,4.3.1.a & 4.3.2.b mandatory fields adjust. Ver 7.3.1: 09-04-2025: SB-10371: S4.3.1.a - mandatory fields adjust. Ver 7.3.1: 03-04-2025: SB-10371: Check XML-XSD Ver 7.3.1: 02-04-2025: SB-10332: Final Ver 7.3.1: 19-03-2025: SB-10332: Correction of bugs of MEDTECH Ver 7.3.1: 13-03-2025: SB-10332 feedback Medtech Ver 7.3.1: 22-01-2025 SB-10225 Feedback MEDTECH : Change attribute for the key "massKG" & "heightCM" to "xsd:integer" for all XSD files Ver 7.3.1: 17-01-2025 SB-10225 Feedback MEDTECH : Resolving issue on signature + section 1.3.1.f unselect radio button + section 4.2.d field mandatory correction Ver 7.3.1: 20 Nov 24 Add default value to sCreateTimeStamp and sFormLanguage Ver 7.3.1: Full restore completed Ver 7.3.1: Red border issue on section 2.3.p Ver 7.3.1: Update the out.xsl for manufacturer issue Ver 7.3.1: Updated the code copy/paste section 2.3.p Ver 7.3.1: Restoring codes due to crash of application (SB-9903) Ver 7.3.1: 01-03-2024 - SB-9481 Fix max length to 4000 Characters Ver 7.3.1: Add some fields, labels and business rules (SB-9263) Ver 7.3.0: add drop-down list, change title (SB-7677)

xsd:annotation.xsd:documentation: Schema for GENERICS reports about Incidents for EU vigilance exchange. version 7.3.1 of 03.2024

xsd:enumeration.value: Unanticipated serious deterioration in state of health
If software, date first made available
This device has been placed on the market before the implementation of the MDD/AIMDD/IVDD
Reuse of a reusable medical device
Reuse of a single use medical device
Devices placed on the market or put into service
Units distributed within each time period
Number of episodes of use (for reusable devices)
Units distributed from the date of declaration of Conformity/CE mark approval to the end date of each time period
All EEA, Turkey and Nothern Ireland
